thread.title: TOP scheme has been a big support: Saina Nehwal
thread.title_full: TOP scheme has been a big support: Saina Nehwal

author: PTI
title: TOP scheme has been a big support: Saina Nehwal
text:
PTI | October 08, 2015, 13.58 pm The World Championship silver medallist will lead India's charge in badminton when the Olympic Games gets underway at Rio de Janeiro next year. (Photo: AFP) New Delhi: One of India's top medal prospects at next year's Olympics, World No 1 shuttler Saina Nehwal on Thursday said the Sports Ministry's Target Olympic Podium (TOP) scheme has been of immense help in her preparation for the Rio Games.
"My sincere appreciation @YASMinistry @Media_SAI @BAIMedia1 for the support over the years. Would not have been here without the support," Saina wrote on her twitter page.
My sincere appreciation @YASMinistry @Media_SAI @BAIMedia1 for the support over the years. Would not have been here without the support.
— Saina Nehwal (@NSaina) October 6, 2015 "Thank you @YASMinistry @Media_SAI @BAIMedia1 for training support under TOP Scheme. #Let'sMakeIndiaProud #Road2Rio."
Thank you @YASMinistry @Media_SAI @BAIMedia1 for training support under TOP Scheme. #Let 'sMakeIndiaProud #Road2Rio
— Saina Nehwal (@NSaina) October 6, 2015 The 25-year-old, who won the bronze medal at the 2012 London Olympics, hoped the TOP scheme will help other athletes as well.
"The @YASMinistry and @Media_SAI TOP Scheme has been a big support on my #Road2Rio. Hope many athletes will continue to benefit," Saina tweeted.
The @YASMinistry and @Media_SAI TOP Scheme has been a big support on my #Road2Rio . Hope many athletes will continue to benefit.
— Saina Nehwal (@NSaina) October 6, 2015 The World Championship silver medallist will lead India's charge in badminton when the Olympic Games gets underway at Rio de Janeiro next year.
 Badminton Saina Nehwal Sports Ministry Target Olympic Podium Candid pictures of star shuttler Saina Nehwal Loading... Please Wait 1/27 Here's a childhood pic of star shuttler Saina Nehwal. Since her childhood, Saina has excelled in sports. She has been a role model for young girls who want to take badminton as their career. 2/27 Here's a young Saina Nehwal dancing with other youngsters at an event. Saina Nehwal looks very much the girl next door looking to have fun. 3/27 Saina Nehwal at a prize distribution ceremony organised by LnT Serene County Games, Gachibowli. Saina has herself received many prizes, the best among them probably is the Olympic bronze. 4/27 Saina Nehwal with a group of school girls in Delhi during an event. She is the first Indian to win the World Junior Badminton Championships and was also the first Indian to win a Super Series tournament. 5/27 Saina with her Olympic bronze medal. Following her success in London Olympics, Saina has received widespread appreciation for efforts on the badminton court. She recently led Hyderabad Hotshots to triumph in Indian Badminton League. 6/27 According to Saina Nehwal, this pics is one of her favourites. She posted this pic on her Twitter account and captioned, 'One of my fav moments last year! Got to fly the Kiran MK II Jet trainer aircraft :) Amazing experience (sic).' 7/27 Saina Nehwal with others before she gets off to flying a Jet trainer aircraft. 8/27 Saina Nehwal with coach Pullela Gopichand. The two share a great master and pupil relationship. Saina credits her success to her coach Gopi. 9/27 The coach and the pupil share a happy moment together. Saina Nehwal was rewarded with Arjuna award in August, 2009 and her coach Gopichand was also rewarded with Dronacharya award at the same time. 10/27 Saina Nehwal is consoled by coach Pullela Gopichand after a loss she suffered in a tournament. Saina's Coach Gopichand advised her not exert too much pressure on herself due to the overwhelming home crowd support. 11/27 Saina Nehwal trains at Pullela Gopichand academy. The new badminton sensation PV Sindhu is also seen practising with her. 12/27 Saina credits much of her success to her training at the academy. Many youngsters have trained here and proved their mettle at the international level. 13/27 Saina takes a break from practice. It's been Saina's hard work that has given her so much success on the badminton court. 14/27 Saina Nehwal with a young fan. Saina's success has inspired generations, especially young girls, to take up sports as a career. 15/27 Saina Nehwal with her mother and badminton star Taufiq Hidayat. In the IBL, Saina Nehwal sparked a controversy when she said that Taufiq should be happy at what he was sold for in the IBL auctions as he is a retired player. She later clarified that it was no way meant to offend the badminton great. 16/27 Saina goes on an outing with her parents abroad. Saina Nehwal was born in a Jat family at Hisar in Haryana. The family later shifted to Hyderabad. Saina's father Harvir Singh and mother Usha Nehwal were both badminton champions in Haryana. 17/27 Even during the trip abroad for a family outing, Saina gets fans queuing up for her autographs. 18/27 Even though Saina excels in badminton, she takes equal interest in watching other sports. Here she catches up some action in IPL. 19/27 Saina Nehwal with Bollywood actor Aamir Khan. Aamir, who has done few sports-related films, has always been supportive of sportstars, especially Saina. 20/27 Saina Nehwal with Bollywood star Aamir Khan and other sportstars during an event. 21/27 Let's play! Saina Nehwal looks to be telling that to Bollywood star Aamir Khan during an event. 22/27 Saina Nehwal is all coy with actor Dharmendra at the 16th annual day function of Airport Authority of India in New Delhi. 23/27 Badminton star Saina Nehwal offered prayers to Lord Venkateswara at Tirumala in September 2012. She was accompanied by father Dr Harvir Singh Nehwal. 24/27 Saina Nehwal at a birthday party of a friend. She posted this pic on her Twitter account and captioned, 'Had a great time at Pranav's birthday. Hope you had a good time yesterday pranav! Have an awesome year :)' 25/27 Saina Nehwal at an event. Saina was India’s highest-paid non-cricketing sportsperson as on September 2012. 26/27 Here's the who's who of sporting legends. Saina Nehwal with Leander Paes, Geet Sethi and Prakash Padukone. Here's what Saina has to say, 'Standing side by side with them is an honour and I truly feel privileged to have their support in my Olympic Gold Quest.' 27/27 Saina Nehwal has been a favourite sportstars to appear in cover images of magazine. Here she gets ready for a photo shoot. Also Read ‘Narendra Modi knows my game like a family member’ Sports Ministry clears funds for Saina, Gowda under TOP scheme Don’t want to interfere in Saina’s game: Pullela Gopichand I am happy to come out as the first Indian to achieve a lot of things in badminton: Saina Nehwal
